etymologies: mid 19th century: from French monétiser, from Latin moneta ‘money’

definitions: earn revenue from (an asset, business, etc.)

examples.text: the company has not said how it expects to monetize the game
some of this content can be monetized

shortDefinitions: earn revenue from asset, business, etc.

definitions: convert into or express in the form of currency

examples.text: Hamilton had monetized the entire federal and state war debts

shortDefinitions: convert into or express in form of currency

definitions: convert or adapt (a society, economy, etc.) to trade based on the exchange of money

examples.text: bringing in specie in exchange for local goods helped to monetize the economy

shortDefinitions: convert or adapt to trade based on exchange of money
